doc:
C. Henry Gordon https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C._Henry_Gordon 0 C. Henry Gordon (born Henry Racke, June 17, 1883 – December 3, 1940) was an American stage and film actor. He was born in New York City, New York and died in Los Angeles, California after having his leg amputated. He was educated both in New York and abroad in Switzerland and Germany. For some years he owned and ran a silver mine in New Mexico but failed to make it pay, so he became an actor. Like many of his generation, he enjoyed a long stage career, on and off Broadway, before entering films. He appeared in 79 films between 1930 and 1940, frequently as a villain, such as Surat Khan in The Charge of the Light Brigade (1936), opposite Errol Flynn. C._Henry_Gordon ( born Henry_Racke , June_17_,_1883 – December_3_,_1940 ) was an_American_stage_and_film_actor . He was_born in New_York_City , New_York and died in Los_Angeles , California after having his_leg amputated . He was educated both in New_York and abroad in Switzerland_and_Germany . For some_years he owned_and_ran a_silver_mine in New_Mexico but failed_to_make it pay , so he became an_actor . Like many of his_generation , he enjoyed a_long_stage_career , on_and_off Broadway , before entering_films . He appeared in 79_films between 1930_and_1940 , frequently as a_villain , such_as Surat_Khan in The_Charge of the_Light_Brigade_(_1936_) , opposite_Errol_Flynn .
